Member Function Documentation

void CClassifiedObjectRegistry::Add (  const string &    RegistryName,
CNamedObject &    rObject
) 
 

Adds an object to a registry. If the item already exists in that registry, a CDuplicateNameException is thrown. If the registry does not exist, a CNoSuchObjectException is thrown.

Parameters:
RegistryName  The name of the registry to add the item to.
rObject  A reference to the object to add to the registry.

RegistryIterator CClassifiedObjectRegistry::beginregistry (    ) 
 

Returns an iterator into the registries which are contained by this object. Note that iterating returns registries, not objects.

Definition at line 469 of file CClassifiedObjectRegistry.cpp.

void CClassifiedObjectRegistry::CreateRegistry (  const string &    RegistryName ) 
 

Creates a new registry. It is not an error to create a registry which already exists. If this is attempted, the function is a no-op.

Parameters:
RegistryName  The name of the registry being created.

Definition at line 314 of file CClassifiedObjectRegistry.cpp.

References m_Registries.

Referenced by CRegisteredObject::RegisterSelf().

void CClassifiedObjectRegistry::DeleteRegistry (  const string &    RegistryName ) 
 

Deletes an existing registry. Any registry entries are destroyed, however the objects they point to are not. If the registry does not exist, a CNoSuchObjectException is thrown.

Parameters:
RegistryName  The name of the registry being destroyed.

Definition at line 334 of file CClassifiedObjectRegistry.cpp.

References m_Registries.

string CClassifiedObjectRegistry::DescribeSelf (    )  [virtual]
 

Produces a string containing the class path and name of the CClassifiedObjectRegistry, the class path and name of all of the CObjectRegistry's contained therein, and the class path and name of all of the CNamedObject's contained within the registries.

Reimplemented from CNamedObject.

RegistryIterator CClassifiedObjectRegistry::endregistry (    ) 
 

Returns a registry iterator suitable for determining when iteration has been completed.

Definition at line 479 of file CClassifiedObjectRegistry.cpp.

CRefcountedPtr< ObjectList > CClassifiedObjectRegistry::Find (  const string &    ObjectName ) 
 

Returns a reference counted pointer to a dynamically allocated list of Objects which match the name requested. The list is drawn from all of the registries. If no registries contain the requested name, an empty list is returned. Note: A reference counted pointer is returned so that the client does not have to remember to delete the list when they are done with it.

Parameters:
ObjectName  The name of the object to search for.

Definition at line 449 of file CClassifiedObjectRegistry.cpp.

References beginregistry(), endregistry(), ObjectIterator, ObjectList, and RegistryIterator.

ObjectIterator CClassifiedObjectRegistry::Find (  const string &    RegistryName,
const string &    ObjectName
) 
 

Locates an object in a specific registry. If the registry or object do not exist, a CNoSuchObjectException is thrown. The name embedded in the exception differentiates between these two cases.

Parameters:
RegistryName  The name of the registry to search for the object in.
ObjectName  The name of the object to search for.

References m_Registries.

void CClassifiedObjectRegistry::Remove (  const string &    RegistryName,
CNamedObject &    Object
) 
 

Removes an object from a registry. The named object is removed from the designated registry. If the object does not exist, or the registry does not exist, a CNoSuchObjectException is thrown. The name embedded in the exception differentiates between these two cases.

Parameters:
RegistryName  The name of the registry containing the object to remove.
Object  A reference to the object being removed.
